Player History
Drafted in 4th round, 94th overall pick, by Pittsburgh in 2003...
Injured on 6/17/2003 with a Strained Groin Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 8/16/2004 with a Pinched Nerve Neck, out for 5 days...
Had first career hit on 9/3/2009, off Lance Broadway (COL)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/10/2011, off Scott Richmond (HOU)...
Traded from Pittsburgh to Cleveland on 1/31/2012 (Going to CLE: P L. Lynn, RF N. Schierholz. Going to PIT: 2B J. Kipnis, P C. Reitsma)...
Injured on 9/18/2014 with a Concussion, out for one week...
Traded from Cleveland to St. Louis on 1/31/2016 (Going to STL: 2B P. Valdejuli, P R. Veloz, P T. Stayton, CF N. Schierholz. Going to CLE: P A. Cashner, P P. Liriano)...
Released by St. Louis on 8/24/2017...
Signed as a free agent by Philadelphia on 8/24/2017 to a 1-year deal worth $2,000,000 per year...
Injured on 5/10/2018 with a Broken Ulna, out for 5 weeks...
Won World Championship with Philadelphia in 2018...
Was selected to the 2019 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/26/2019, hitting .565 with 1 HR, 1 RBI...
Signed as a free agent by Milwaukee on 2/6/2020 to a 2-year deal worth $5,750,000 per year...
Injured on 8/2/2020 with a Hyper Extended Knee, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Chicago (N) on 7/26/2021...
Signed as a free agent by Cleveland on 2/1/2022 to a 1-year deal worth $1,000,000 per year...
